If you want to allow your users to categorize their blog entries, create the categories below. This feature is useful if you want to list all your users' blog entries that If you have no categories, your users will not be given the option of assigning a blog category.

column1: There are no blog entries by your members yet.
column2: There are no blog entries by your members yet.

This page lists all of the blog entries your users have posted. You can use this page to monitor these blogs and delete offensive material if necessary. Entering criteria into the filter fields will help you find specific blog entries. Leaving the filter fields blank will show all the blog entries on your social network.

column1: Are you sure that you want to delete this blog entry? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.
column2: Are you sure that you want to delete this blog entry? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.

column1: These settings affect all members in your community.
column2: These settings affect all members in your community.

column1: How many blog entries will be shown per page? (Enter a number between 1 and 999)
column2: How many blog entries will be shown per page? (Enter a number between 1 and 999)

Select whether or not you want to let the public (visitors that are not logged-in) to view the following sections of your social network. In some cases (such as Profiles, Blogs, and Albums), if you have given them the option, your users will be able to make their pages private even though you have made them publically viewable here. For more permissions settings, please visit the General Settings page.

column1: No, the public cannot view blogs.
column2: No, the public cannot view blogs.

These settings are applied on a per member level basis. Start by selecting the member level you want to modify, then adjust the settings for that level below.

column1: Do you want to let members view blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members view blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow blogs to be viewed.
column2: No, do not allow blogs to be viewed.

column1: Yes, allow viewing of all blogs, even private ones.
column2: Yes, allow viewing of all blogs, even private ones.

column1: Do you want to let members edit blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members edit blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow members to edit their blogs.
column2: No, do not allow members to edit their blogs.

column1: Yes, allow members to edit their own blogs.
column2: Yes, allow members to edit their own blogs.

column1: Yes, allow members to edit all blogs.
column2: Yes, allow members to edit all blogs.

column1: If you want to allow specific HTML tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). Example: b, img, a, embed, font
column2: If you want to allow specific HTML tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). Example: b, img, a, embed, font

column1: If you enable this feature, your members will be able to customize the colors and fonts of their blogs by altering their CSS styles.
column2: If you enable this feature, your members will be able to customize the colors and fonts of their blogs by altering their CSS styles.

column1: Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post comments on their entries. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.
column2: Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post comments on their entries. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

column1: Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their blog entries. These options appear on your members' "Add Entry" and "Edit Entry" pages. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.
column2: Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their blog entries. These options appear on your members' "Add Entry" and "Edit Entry" pages. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

column1: Do you want to let members create blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want members to be able to view blogs, but only want certain levels to be able to create blogs.
column2: Do you want to let members create blogs? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want members to be able to view blogs, but only want certain levels to be able to create blogs.
